meanings.sent1: The anaplasia in the cells caused confusion in identifying their types.
meanings.sent2: Doctors studied the anaplasia in the tissue samples to understand the disease progression.
meanings.sent3: The anaplasia in the cells made them play a game of 'guess the cell type'.
meanings.sent4: The anaplasia in the cells was like a puzzle where the pieces lost their unique shapes.
meanings.sent5: The anaplasia in the cells was a blur of identities, like a crowd of identical twins.

meanings.definition: Reversion of cells to a more primitive or undifferentiated form
meanings.sent1: The anaplasia of the cells made them resemble simpler organisms.
meanings.sent2: Scientists observed the anaplasia in the cells as they regressed in development.
meanings.sent3: The anaplasia of the cells turned them into tiny time travelers to the past.
meanings.sent4: The anaplasia in the cells was like a rewind button for their growth.
meanings.sent5: The anaplasia in the cells was a journey back to their cellular origins.
